caption.title: Progression of multiple drought types in each river basin.
caption.p: Spatial maps of the ( A) number, ( B) duration in months, and ( C) maximum drought severity (of a single event) of meteorological, agricultural, and hydrologic droughts during the baseline period, 2071–2100 (RCP4.5), and 2071–2100 (RCP8.5), respectively. The blue, green, and red maps represent meteorological, agricultural, and hydrologic droughts, respectively. We define a drought event as a continuous period of one or more months with precipitation, soil moisture, or streamflow less than −1 SD from the baseline average. The drought duration is in months (see Fig. 1A to identify the locations of basins).
